result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan C Rodriguez in court. Interpreter St. John appeared for the Defendant. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Defendant advised to contact SPD on Wednesday morning an interpreter is available. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan C Rodriguez in court. Defendant needs interpreter. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH E.D.C.H.G. (dob 6-14-1977) OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
